18#include "BitArray.h"
19#include "ByteArray.h"
20
21#include <cstddef>
22#include <stdexcept>
23
24#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
25#include "BitHacks.h"
26#include <algorithm>
27#endif
28
29namespace ZXing {
30
31#ifndef ZX_FAST_BIT_STORAGE
32
33bool
34BitArray::isRange(int start, int end, bool value) const
35{
36 if (end < start || start < 0 || end > _size) {
37 throw std::invalid_argument("BitArray::isRange(): Invalid range");
38 }
39 if (end == start) {
40 return true; // empty range matches
41 }
42 end--; // will be easier to treat this as the last actually set bit -- inclusive
43 int firstInt = start / 32;
44 int lastInt = end / 32;
45 for (int i = firstInt; i <= lastInt; i++) {
46 int firstBit = i > firstInt ? 0 : start & 0x1F;
47 int lastBit = i < lastInt ? 31 : end & 0x1F;
48 // Ones from firstBit to lastBit, inclusive
49 uint32_t mask = (2UL << lastBit) - (1UL << firstBit);
50 // Return false if we're looking for 1s and the masked bits[i] isn't all 1s (that is,
51 // equals the mask, or we're looking for 0s and the masked portion is not all 0s
52 if ((_bits[i] & mask) != (value ? mask : 0U)) {
53 return false;
54 }
55 }
56 return true;
57}
58
59void
60BitArray::appendBits(int value, int numBits)
61{
62 if (numBits < 0 || numBits > 32) {
63 throw std::invalid_argument("BitArray::appendBits(): Num bits must be between 0 and 32");
64 }
65 int i = _size;
66 _size += numBits;
67 _bits.resize((_size + 31) / 32, 0);
68
69 for (--numBits; numBits >= 0; --numBits, ++i) {
70 _bits[i / 32] |= ((value >> numBits) & 1) << (i & 0x1F);
71 }
72}
73
74void
75BitArray::appendBit(bool bit)
76{
77 _bits.resize((_size + 1 + 31) / 32, 0);
78 if (bit) {
79 _bits[_size / 32] |= 1 << (_size & 0x1F);
80 }
81 _size++;
82}
83
84
85void
86BitArray::appendBitArray(const BitArray& other)
87{
88 if (_bits.empty()) {
89 *this = other.copy();
90 }
91 else if (other._size > 0) {
92 unsigned offset = static_cast<unsigned>(_bits.size()) * 32 - _size;
93 if (offset > 0) {
94 auto buffer = other._bits;
95 _bits.back() = (_bits.back() & (0xffffffff >> offset)) | (buffer.front() << (32 - offset));
96 BitHacks::ShiftRight(buffer, offset);
97 size_t prevBlockSize = _bits.size();
98 _size += other._size;
99 _bits.resize((_size + 31) / 32);
100 std::copy_n(buffer.begin(), _bits.size() - prevBlockSize, _bits.begin() + prevBlockSize);
101 }
102 else {
103 _size += other._size;
104 _bits.insert(_bits.end(), other._bits.begin(), other._bits.end());
105 }
106 }
107}
108#endif
109
110void
111BitArray::bitwiseXOR(const BitArray& other)
112{
113 if (size() != other.size()) {
114 throw std::invalid_argument("BitArray::xor(): Sizes don't match");
115 }
116 for (size_t i = 0; i < _bits.size(); i++) {
117 // The last int could be incomplete (i.e. not have 32 bits in
118 // it) but there is no problem since 0 XOR 0 == 0.
119 _bits[i] ^= other._bits[i];
120 }
121}
122
123ByteArray BitArray::toBytes(int bitOffset, int numBytes) const
124{
125 ByteArray res(numBytes);
126 for (int i = 0; i < numBytes; i++)
127 for (int j = 0; j < 8; j++)
128 (res[i] <<= 1) |= (get(bitOffset++) ? 1 : 0);
129 return res;
130}
131
132} // ZXing
